mainTitle: Pope Francis's Last Will Details Burial wishes in Papal Basilica

dialogue.line: Did you hear about Pope Francis's last will and testament? It details where he wants to be buried after his death.
Oh, that sounds so interesting! I can't believe he left such detailed instructions about his final resting place.
Yes, it's quite intriguing. He wants to be buried in the Papal Basilica of Santa Maria Maggiore with a simple tomb and only his name etched on it.
That sounds so serene! I wonder why he chose that particular spot.
Well, considering the places he visited during his apostolic journeys, it makes sense. He'd want to pray there at the end of his life.
It's amazing how thoughtful that is! It shows he really reflected on his faith before passing on.
His will also mentions a specific attachment, which I assume has more details about the preparation of his tomb. That must have been meticulous.
I can imagine how much work that must have taken to prepare such a simple yet meaningful space for him.
It's incredible how he wanted something so straightforward. It shows his humility and devotion to the faith.
It's impressive how detailed his wishes were, even for a simple burial. I can only imagine what it must have meant to him.
